page.title: 05Glebe Farm,Bubbenhall
page.content: Glebe Farm is situated South east of BUBBENALL and is farmed by Mr. Webb. His family have lived there for 15 years. He has lived there for 11 of them This mixed farm is 80 acres, most of which he uses for his main crops,barley,wheat and oats,divided into 7 of the 10 fields he rents.The corn is cash crop but the oats he uses to feed his pedigree sheep consisting of Texel and Suffolk breeds. He owns a combine harvester, 3 tractors, a cattle trailer, land rover, machinery necessary for hay making, and 3 trailers.Housing for 180 ewes,deep litter barn for storing hay and straw. He spends around Â£2000 to Â£3000 a year on machinery.He has 6 buildings in which he stores or houses his animals and machinery.
